name: Hilton Hanoi Opera

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location facing the Opera House and only a short walk from the Hoan Keim Lake. The rooms are spacious, well decorated, and quiet.
reviews.title: International standards with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a nice spacious lobby / bar area with live music in the evenings. The food was good but expensive by local standards, however this is to be expected at a major hotel chain. For alternatives there a number of good local restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although not as elegant and unique as the Metropole, and a little lacking in genuine Vietnamese touches this hotel is a good quality choice for Hanoi with international standards.
reviews.title: Hanoi Hilton: Convenience and comfort but short on style

likes.disliked: — Overall decor, especially of the 2 hotel restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent service. Excellent facilities. friendly staff. brilliant location.
reviews.title: Great location and nice clean rooms at a great price

likes.liked: — Great location, clean rooms at a great price
likes.disliked: — Feels like staying at a Grandma's house.

reviews.text: We wanted a central hotel to explore Hanoi for a couple of days and the Hilton Opera was well placed for walking to many of the main tourist attractions. We arrived around 9 pm after long traffic delays from the airport (due to several road crashes). The hotel has a rather cramped vehicle arrival space; it is situated on a tight urban site but once inside the lobby is spacious. As Hilton Honours Gold members we were escorted to a separate check in area on the 7th floor (executive level) and upgraded to a suite. The room was spacious and well equipped with some nice touches like fresh fruit and flowers. The décor was a little too fussy and lacked style. Like the room, the executive lounge, the two restaurants and lobby all lack a real sense of co-ordinated style: this is not the chicest Hilton in the chain.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

likes.liked: — service staff are very polite and helpful
likes.disliked: — carpet in the corridoor is dirty & TV is very old model needs to be replaced.

reviews.text: I can not recommend this hotel to anyone. It is too expensive and it upsets me that I paid a lot of money for a nice hotel that turned out to be not good. I left the hotel immediately and changed for what is often considered to be the best hotel in town. The price was almost the same so this solution I can recommend. Or go for a really simple hotel and get better value for money ratio.
reviews.title: Bad rooms - high price

reviews.text: I have stayed in many Hilton hotels across Asia and it has often been a very nice experience. Therefore I was surprised to experience this. Until they reinvest some of all the money they make on this hotel in a decent renovation - stay away.
reviews.title: Marginally expensive

likes.disliked: — The front desk staff were not as good as the cost or brand would have suggested.

reviews.text: Due to visa problems I missed one of the nights at the Ha Noi Hilton I had paid for via the Internet. I have no problems with that but when I asked for a quote to extend my stay the front desk staff quoted a higher rate, which I found disappointing (although I must note that the rate I paid was an Internet advance purchase rate).
reviews.title: Great Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff were not as efficient as I would have expected. I was first directed to a room where the porter was unable to open the door with my room card. When he opened the door we were surprised to find the room already occupied. After a call to reception they directed us to another room where my card again didn't work. The portor opened the door with his card and thankfully, the room was unoccupied.
reviews.title: Grrreat Hotel
What a surprise!
reviews.text: The hotel is expensive compared with other comparable options in Ha Noi although that said, unlike other reviews I found the premises to be of a high standard. The bar was expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 6 nights with a 5 night Halong Bay/Cat Ba trip sandwiched in the middle during December.
reviews.title: Much better than some reviews indicate

reviews.text: Very pleasently surprising as many reviews seemed fairly negative about this hotel. Welcoming staff on arrival with registration dealt with very efficiently.
reviews.title: Marginal Hilton - stay at the Metropole

reviews.text: We has a lovely 5th floor room with small balcony. Fresh fruit in room on arrival. Rooms are absolutely huge and it looks to have been completely refurbished in recent months. The beds are to die for with super pillows and duvet giving a great nights sleep. Bathrooms also very large with seperate walk in shower. Usual array of Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries as in most Hilton Hotels.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't take breakfast in the hotel.
reviews.title: hated the hilton hanoi

reviews.text: Also didn't use the leisure facilities so can't really comment.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel-But Not My Favorite In Hanoi

reviews.text: Hanoi is beautiful, full of small streets, but it is also very poor and when you enter the Hilton, you feel like in a different world. They have same amenities as anywhere in the world. As a Gold card member, we got upgraded and got club access, which is really good, full of nice hors d'oeuvres and great american breakfast. Rooms are typical Hilton, Lobby is a little bit 'too' big and uninviting. If you can get it at around 100euro/night its good price, otherwis, check out Sofitel Metropole for character.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in communist city

reviews.text: Have stayed at Hanoi Sheraton and Fortuna, and my first time at the Hanoi Hilton.
reviews.title: Slightly above average, but only slightly

reviews.text: Picked up at the airport by the hotel car, which is a BMW 5/7 series, and you can select the ipod music, very cool.
reviews.title: Great location, good hotel (not amazing but nothing wrong with it)

reviews.text: The hotel lobby is the typical large atrium, 5-star wanna-be, a little dated look. The check-in process was decently quick. Immediately noticed there were the Mont Blanc and Dunhill boutiques, but I doubt tourists came to Hanoi for these. The Metropole has Cartier and LV, so 1 up on a non-critical service for them.
reviews.title: Not up to Asian hotel standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room has the same wanna-be look. The tv is the old cathode ray type, and the remote was so worn that all the white print was missing, not good. The toilet has a very small shower cubicle and I don't envy any large sized customers. The only plus point is that I think it has better sound-proofing that most hotels in Vietnam, which is a necessity considering how all the vehicles love to use their horns in Vietnam.
reviews.title: Superior Property, No Complaints

description: Centrally located in Hanoi's elegant French Quarter, the Hilton Hanoi Opera hotel is a short walk from the famous Old Quarter and the city's bustling business district. Recently awarded 'Best Business Hotel in Hanoi 2010' and voted 'Vietnam's Leading Hotel for five consecutive years at the prestigious World Travel Awards, the Hilton Hanoi Opera hotel is a landmark in the city.
